io.sarl.lang.compiler.batch

Class AbstractJavaBatchCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sarl.lang.compiler.batch.AbstractJavaBatchCompiler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public abstract class AbstractJavaBatchCompiler
extends Object
implements IJavaBatchCompiler
    Abstract implementation for the Java batch compilers.

      • compile

        public final def compile(classDirectory : File,
                         sourcePathDirectories : Iterable<File>,
                         classPathEntries : Iterable<File>,
                         modulePathEntries : Iterable<File>,
                         bootClassPathEntries : List<File>,
                         javaVersion : String,
                         encoding : String,
                         isCompilerMoreVerbose : boolean,
                         optimizationLevel : OptimizationLevel,
                         outWriter : PrintWriter,
                         errWriter : PrintWriter,
                         logger : Logger,
                         progress : org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor) : CompilerStatus 
        Description copied from interface: IJavaBatchCompiler
        Run the Java compiler.
        Specified by:
        compile in interface IJavaBatchCompiler
        Parameters:
        classDirectory - the output directory.
        sourcePathDirectories - the source directories.
        classPathEntries - classpath entries.
        modulePathEntries - classpath entries. No more used.
        javaVersion - the version of Java that is the target, e.g. 1.8.
        encoding - the encoding of the files.
        isCompilerMoreVerbose - indicates if the Java compiler should be more verbose.
        optimizationLevel - the level of optimization to apply to the byte code or null if the defaults must be applied.
        outWriter - the standard output writer.
        errWriter - the standard error writer.
        logger - the logger to use for debugging messages.
        progress - monitor of the progress of the compilation.
        Returns:
        the success status; Never null.

      • compile

        protected abstract def compile(classDirectory : File,
                               sourcePathDirectories : Iterable<File>,
                               classPathEntries : Iterable<File>,
                               modulePathEntries : Iterable<File>,
                               bootClassPathEntries : List<File>,
                               javaVersion : org.eclipse.xtext.util.JavaVersion,
                               isModuleSupport : boolean,
                               encoding : String,
                               isCompilerMoreVerbose : boolean,
                               optimizationLevel : OptimizationLevel,
                               outWriter : PrintWriter,
                               errWriter : PrintWriter,
                               logger : Logger,
                               progress : org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor) : CompilerStatus 
        Description copied from class: AbstractJavaBatchCompiler
        Run the Java compiler.
        Parameters:
        classDirectory - the output directory.
        sourcePathDirectories - the source directories.
        classPathEntries - classpath entries.
        modulePathEntries - classpath entries. No more used.
        javaVersion - the version of Java that is the target, e.g. 1.8.
        isModuleSupport - indicates if modules are supported.
        encoding - the encoding of the files.
        isCompilerMoreVerbose - indicates if the Java compiler should be more verbose.
        optimizationLevel - the level of optimization to apply to the byte code or null if the defaults must be applied.
        outWriter - the standard output writer.
        errWriter - the standard error writer.
        logger - the logger to use for debugging messages.
        progress - monitor of the progress of the compilation.
        Returns:
        the success status; Never null.
